bibliographic_metadata.Title: A multistage algorithm to generate a predictive porphyry intrusion evidential map with low uncertainty for mineral prospectivity mapping, case study in Pariz Area, Iran
bibliographic_metadata.Author: Gholam-Reza Elyasi, Abbas Bahroudi, Maysam Abedi

abstract: This study introduces a multistage algorithm to generate a predictive porphyry intrusion evidential map using magnetic data. The algorithm includes steps such as radial symmetry transformation, non-minimum suppression, amplitude contrast transformation, and active contour algorithm. Implemented on aeromagnetic data from the Pariz region in Iran, the results identified all six known deposits and discovered a new porphyry copper deposit, enhancing mineral prospectivity mapping.
methodology: supervised > tree-based > random forest; supervised > tree-based > gradient boosting (GBDT); supervised > tree-based > XGBoost; supervised > tree-based > LightGBM; supervised > tree-based > CatBoost
key_points: Introduced a multistage algorithm for generating evidential maps.
Successfully identified all six known porphyry copper deposits.
Discovered a new porphyry copper deposit with significant resources.
Enhanced prediction accuracy and reduced uncertainty in mineral prospectivity mapping.
Delineated 20% of the study area as prospective targets for further exploration.
